question.body: Why is male pattern baldness more common in males than females?

multiple_choice.choice: This gene is carried on the X chromosome so a man can get it from his father.
This gene is carried on the Y chromosome so a woman would have to get it from both her mom and her dad.
This gene is carried on the X chromosome so a woman would have to get it from both her mom and her dad.
This gene is carried on the Y chromosome so a woman would not be able to inherit it at all.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Male pattern baldness is carried on the X chromosome so a male would have to get it from his mother.
Incorrect. A woman cannot inherit a gene on the Y chromosome because women do not have a Y chromosome.
Correct. Because women have two X chromosomes, they would need to have two copies of the recessive allele to exhibit the trait.

Incorrect. A woman cannot inherit a gene on the Y chromosome because women do not have a Y chromosome; but she could inherit this disease if she gets an X chromosome with the gene from both her mother and her father.

part.hint: Men have one X chromosome and one Y chromosome. Women have two X chromosomes.
